revised_title: Anatomical and Physiological Study of the Bronchial Vascular System in Dogs
tldr: This study investigates the bronchial vascular system in dogs, focusing on the arrangement of bronchial arteries and veins, and the possible communications between the bronchial and pulmonary vascular systems. The researchers examined 26 animals and found that the bronchial arteries supply the bronchial tree up to the small bronchioles, while the blood from the bronchial artery supplying the hilum drains into the azygos, hemi-azygos, or intercostal veins. The study also discusses the techniques used for injecting the vessels and examining the specimens.
